channel.title: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
channel.description:
Hello everyone.
I am looking for [b]one[/b] client developer and [b]one to three[/b] model artists for an upcoming project of mine. The project is going to be a very innovative one which will attract a lot of publicity, will be unique and will be something that you can place on your portfolio. You will be compensated financially should the project receive any money.
Requirements for [b]client developer[/b]:
[ul][li]You must have experience working with a team. This does not have to be a software development team, any examples of where you have successfully worked with a team will be considered.[/li] [li]You must have a strong programming background with Java experience.[/li] [li]You must have experience with version control systems, preferably Git.[/li] [li]You must have an understanding of the RuneScape client from a front-end perspective at least. You do not need to fully understand the mechanics behind it but understanding the client will make it a lot easier for you to work on it.[/li] [li]You must have an understanding of the code style in the [url=https://github.com/Jameskmonger/317refactor]317refactor project[/url]. This does not have to be an in-depth understanding however you must have read through the majority of the code.[/li] [li]You must have a can-do attitude. This is going to be a tough project however the rewards will be great when we complete the project.[/li] [li]Applicants with a portfolio of works will be strongly favoured. I will be particularly impressed if you can create something, however small, using the [url=https://github.com/Jameskmonger/317refactor]317refactor project[/url]. (Seriously, create something using the 317refactor project and you will be strongly considered against all other applicants.)[/li][/ul]
Requirements for [b]model artist[/b]:
[ul][li]You must have experience creating models in formats suitable for the 317 RuneScape client. This does not just include creating them in the correct file type but also being able to convert them into the correct type, animating the models and creating them with suitable polygon counts.[/li] [li]You must have experience working with a team. This does not have to be a software development team, any examples of where you have successfully worked with a team will be considered.[/li] [li]You must have a portfolio of models that you have created yourself.[/li] [li]You must be willing to learn whilst working. You will be required to take on a large amount of tasks, including creating the models, rigging the models and creating animations for them. You do not need to be able to do all of these as long as you are willing to learn.[/li] [li]You must be able to create models in a low-poly style similar to that of the 2005/2006 RuneScape style.[/li][/ul]
All applicants must be able to dedicate at least 4 hours a week to work on the project. As I have stated, this project will attract a lot of publicity and will therefore be one that you can place on your portfolios in future.
If you are interested in applying, please send me a forum PM explaining which position you are applying for and how you meet the criteria listed above.

item.title: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

FoHammer:

Nothing is far fetched, but I’m curious, because if he’s doing this I’m probably interested.

Yes, that is what I am doing. I currently have a graphics artist working with me who can produce very, very high quality models. I am looking for other team members nonetheless.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @FoHammer FoHammer
item.description:
@FoHammer wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:18, topic:551689”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=670604.msg4485421#msg4485421 date=1433719262]

Skimmed over it so don’t be mad at me for asking this, but is this a rsps project or an actual game project?

Depends on how you look at it. It’s going to use the RuneScape engine but isn’t going to be an attempt to emulate RuneScape.
[/quote]
Wait so you’re making a completely different game using the RuneScape engine?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:13, topic:551689”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=670604.msg4485025#msg4485025 date=1433450981]

Can you verify that this isn’t runescape development? If so why is it in the RSPS development team board?

Its not going to be a project that emulates the RuneScape server however it is still a project using the #317 RuneScape client and therefore belongs here.
[/quote]The funorb arcanists client is based on the runescape base, does that mean a development team for that should be here? No… this isn’t the runescape engine board, it’s the private server board. If you’re working on something different we have other boards for that.

Would you prefer me moving it to Game Development or Java Programming?

As a whole the engine is going to stay the same and the mechanics are going to stay the same, but there are going to be a lot of cache and content changes. I don’t want to give too much away yet but when you’re in the game you’ll be able to tell that it was based on RuneScape. If you think it’d be better suited elsewhere, feel free to move it

Pure, what is the meaning of getMEBInt and getMESInt?[/quote]I’m going to move it to game development; not only because of the changes, but also because of the way the topic is set up. No real information about the project doesn’t really suit this section

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile

Would you prefer me moving it to Game Development or Java Programming?

As a whole the engine is going to stay the same and the mechanics are going to stay the same, but there are going to be a lot of cache and content changes. I don’t want to give too much away yet but when you’re in the game you’ll be able to tell that it was based on RuneScape. If you think it’d be better suited elsewhere, feel free to move it

Pure, what is the meaning of getMEBInt and getMESInt?[/quote]middle endian [big/small]
https://rswiki.moparisthebest.com/index.php?title=Data_Types

Read full topic

A lot of other commonly refactored stuff are missing too. I don’t understand what is so great about your client but whatever, good luck on the project!

https://github.com/Jameskmonger/317refactor/blob/master/src/com/jagex/runescape/Buffer.java
put24BitInt
getForceLEShort
getInt1
getInt2

ps I probably wouldn’t put stolen content on my portfolio, jus sayn[/quote]

I was going to say this

Would you prefer me moving it to Game Development or Java Programming?

item.title: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:7, topic:551689”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=670604.msg4484911#msg4484911 date=1433369554]
I think before you continue using ‘your’ client you might want to figure out what you’re doing with your networking, I’m sure it’s a crucial part of your project. A lot of other commonly refactored stuff are missing too. I don’t understand what is so great about your client but whatever, good luck on the project!

https://github.com/Jameskmonger/317refactor/blob/master/src/com/jagex/runescape/Buffer.java
put24BitInt
getForceLEShort
getInt1
getInt2

ps I probably wouldn’t put stolen content on my portfolio, jus sayn
[/quote]

If you could give me some suggestions for better names I’d really appreciate it. Networking is not my strong point

There have been countless people around the world who have landed programming jobs after working on fan projects of copyrighted intellectual property. Provided it is provided free of charge, there’s rarely an issue. Jacmob is probably the most relevant example for our community.[/quote]I think that the only way you could get a job out of this, is if you get very lucky and are very intelligent (note how Jacmob is both of those things). Nevertheless good luck with your project, some more information about it would be nice if you are able to elaborate it.

edit: I have submitted a pull request to your repo, updating the naming for that class.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Hello everyone.

I am looking for one client developer and one to three model artists for an upcoming project of mine. The project is going to be a very innovative one which will attract a lot of publicity, will be unique and will be something that you can place on your portfolio. You will be compensated financially should the project receive any money.

Requirements for client developer:

[ul][li]You must have experience working with a team. This does not have to be a software development team, any examples of where you have successfully worked with a team will be considered.[/li]
[li]You must have a strong programming background with Java experience.[/li]
[li]You must have experience with version control systems, preferably Git.[/li]
[li]You must have an understanding of the RuneScape client from a front-end perspective at least. You do not need to fully understand the mechanics behind it but understanding the client will make it a lot easier for you to work on it.[/li]
[li]You must have an understanding of the code style in the 317refactor project. This does not have to be an in-depth understanding however you must have read through the majority of the code.[/li]
[li]You must have a can-do attitude. This is going to be a tough project however the rewards will be great when we complete the project.[/li]
[li]Applicants with a portfolio of works will be strongly favoured. I will be particularly impressed if you can create something, however small, using the 317refactor project. (Seriously, create something using the 317refactor project and you will be strongly considered against all other applicants.)[/li][/ul]

Requirements for model artist:

[ul][li]You must have experience creating models in formats suitable for the 317 RuneScape client. This does not just include creating them in the correct file type but also being able to convert them into the correct type, animating the models and creating them with suitable polygon counts.[/li]
[li]You must have experience working with a team. This does not have to be a software development team, any examples of where you have successfully worked with a team will be considered.[/li]
[li]You must have a portfolio of models that you have created yourself.[/li]
[li]You must be willing to learn whilst working. You will be required to take on a large amount of tasks, including creating the models, rigging the models and creating animations for them. You do not need to be able to do all of these as long as you are willing to learn.[/li]
[li]You must be able to create models in a low-poly style similar to that of the 2005/2006 RuneScape style.[/li][/ul]

All applicants must be able to dedicate at least 4 hours a week to work on the project. As I have stated, this project will attract a lot of publicity and will therefore be one that you can place on your portfolios in future.

If you are interested in applying, please send me a forum PM explaining which position you are applying for and how you meet the criteria listed above.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for developers and model artists - Ambokile
